meanings.definition: To deprive of possession or occupancy
meanings.sent1: The landlord tried to disseize the tenant of the apartment.
meanings.sent2: The government can disseize property for public use.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel disseized the birds of their nests for fun.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to disseize the trees of their leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell appeared to disseize the rabbit from the hat in a blink.

meanings.definition: To eject or oust from land or property
meanings.sent1: The new owner wanted to disseize the previous tenants from the house.
meanings.sent2: The court can disseize someone from their land if they fail to pay taxes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat disseized the dog from its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise seemed to disseize the birds from their peaceful roosting place.
meanings.sent5: The bright light appeared to disseize the shadows from the room, revealing everything.
